title: French prosecutors probe death of man 'likely caused by rubber bullet to the chest'
description: French prosecutors have opened an investigation into the death of a man during riots in Marseille.

title: Israel starts withdrawal from West Bank city of Jenin
description: Israeli troops have been pulling out of the Palestinian city of Jenin following one of their biggest West Bank operations in years.

title: New record set for world's hottest day
description: The world has experienced its hottest day on record, according to meteorologists.

title: Disaster zone travel specialist clinches £40m private equity sale
description: A travel agent which specialises in transporting aid workers to warzones is close to changing hands in a deal worth about £40m.

title: Mobiles, tablets and smartwatches to be banned in Dutch classrooms
description: Phones, tablets and smartwatches will be mostly banned from classrooms in the Netherlands from 1 January 2024.

title: Man's headless body discovered in hotel room
description: The headless body of a man has been discovered in a hotel in Japan, it has been reported.

title: Irish police support investigation into deaths of two students on Greek island
description: Irish police have flown to the Greek holiday island of Ios to assist in the investigation into the deaths of two classmates from Dublin, as preparations to repatriate them get under way.

title: Taliban bans women's beauty salons in Afghanistan
description: The Taliban has ordered beauty salons in Afghanistan to close, a government spokesperson has said.

title: Israel's Jenin operation may have achieved its objectives - but it will have also deepened hatred
description: There's only one road into Jenin - the checkpoint to the north is closed as Israel's military operations continue into its second day and temporary army posts hold up the traffic a few miles out as soldiers check every car going in.

title: Journalist and lawyer beaten up by armed masked men on way to court
description: An award-winning Russian journalist, who has spent years investigating purported human rights abuses in Chechnya, has been seriously injured in an attack by armed masked men.

title: Neymar fined £2.6m over construction work at his coastal mansion
description: Brazilian authorities have said that Neymar has been fined £2.6m (16m reais) for breaching environmental rules while building his coastal home.

title: Seabirds facing new threat from 'swirling collections of plastic' in feeding grounds
description: Seabirds could be mistaking bits of plastic that have polluted their regular feeding grounds for food, new research has found.

title: Champion skydiver killed trying high-risk landing in Texas
description: A 29-year-old champion skydiver was killed in Texas while attempting a high-risk landing.

title: Hiker killed after 200ft fall in popular waterfall
description: A man has died after falling 200ft from a cliff in Oregan, police have said.

title: New octopus species discovered 2,800 metres below sea off Costa Rican coast
description: A new species of octopus has been found in a deep-sea nursery off the coast of Costa Rica.

title: Subway condemned over 'distasteful' Titan sub tragedy sign
description: Sandwich chain Subway has been criticised after staff joked about the Titan submersible tragedy on a roadside sign.

title: Five dead and two children injured in US mass shooting
description: Five people have been killed and two children injured in a shooting in Philadelphia.

title: Three drones intercepted 'heading for Moscow' - Russia accuses Ukraine of 'terrorist attack'
description: Russia has claimed it has shot down and intercepted multiple Ukrainian drones over Moscow in what it described as a "terrorist attack".

title: Seven casualties in 'Palestinian car-ramming and stabbing attack' in Israel
description: At least seven casualties have been reported in what is believed to be a car-ramming and stabbing attack by Palestinians in Israel.

title: Thousands flee refugee camp after Israel carries out deadly raid on Palestinian city of Jenin
description: Thousands of people have fled a refugee camp in the occupied West Bank after Israel launched a deadly military operation on Monday.

title: 'The next Nahel could be saved': Teenage rioter says French police should wear body cameras to rebuild trust
description: One of the teenagers in the middle of the rioting in Paris has warned that violence could return at any moment.
